name: Carlton Hotel & C Spa Kinsale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was a little shabby. Our lights weren't working. Had to ask them to fix. The pumps in the bar were broken also so only bottles available. There was poor atmosphere in the bar. I thought they might have entertainment for bank holiday weekend. The breakfast was nice and staff were friendly. No robes in rooms for leisure centre. Shuttle bus into town was useful.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: Nice hotel but doesn't live up to 4 star rating or room rate. You can tell the hotel is in financial difficulties and doesn't have the cash to spend on essential refurbishment and upgrading.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but in need of a refurb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a hotel that is only 6 years old, the bar area and reception were shabby. 1 lift was out of order throughout our 4 night stay and the rooms were dated.
reviews.title: Stunning view.

reviews.text: For €140 per night I would expect more.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Bedrooms are tired - no minibar, lack of complimentary water and the TV signal was awful.
reviews.title: One night stay

reviews.text: A little note to say I recently attended a wedding and had the most terrific time - the staff were just superb and made the day all the more special. I was delighted to see a familiar face in Jackie Brierley who had looked after us splendidly before in the Rcyc and once again she was brilliant as were all the bar staff on the night. I most also mention the wonderful night manager who escorted me with his umbrella on the wicked wet night I delivered the wedding cake - the staff made our stay at the Carlton all the more wonderful.
reviews.title: Terrific staff that made our stay so brill

reviews.text: A beautiful location with stunning countryside views. The hotel itself is nice and private. Spa and swimming pool are very nice. We stayed for a wedding and found that the rate for the room did not match the quality. The rooms are getting tired and shabby looking. One of the chairs in our room had a massive stain on it. It could do with a cleanliness revamp in my opinion to justify the price.
reviews.title: Expensive but fabulous location

reviews.text: Overall though its a nice hotel with excellent facilities and in a great location. The food was good but if you're staying for something other than a wedding, i would recommend heading into Kinsale town itself.
reviews.title: Delicious carvery!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have eaten a carvery in carlton on several occasions.great for sunday luch with family and friends.lovely food,delicious dessers, big selection,big portions.very friendly stuff.beautiful view from the restaurant window.definitely worth recomending.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but some way outside Kinsale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, located about 4/5 kilometres outside Kinsale. Checkin was quick, courteous and informative. Our room was large with a lovely comfortable bed. There were floor to ceiling windows with stunning eastern views out over Oysterhaven Bay. We stayed for three nights in April 2013 and were lucky enough to have good clear weather which I took advantage of to watch magnificent and spectacular sunrises, out over the bay and the surrounding hills. We used the hotel as a base to explore Kinsale and the surrounding countryside. We also spent some time relaxing in the hotel and we used the nice pool and hydrotherapy facilities every day. Breakfast is excellent with good quality food in an eat all you can buffet style - perfect to start the day. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant one evening and we were very pleased with the quality. I wouldn't recommend a visit to the bar in the hotel. It's very dark, dull and basic with no windows, no music, no decor to speak of and no atmosphere. In fact it looks just like an afterthought stuck into an empty space. A mini bus shuttle service operates every evening from 5.30p.m. from the hotel into Kinsale and back again every half hour up to half past midnight (€3 per person per trip). This is a very welcome service. We were able to eat and drink in Kinsale town with the comfort of not having to worry about driving back out to the hotel afterwards. The bed was made and the room was cleaned each day but having said that, we were left short of shampoo/shower wash and toilet paper and just about reached the end of our stay using a box of tissues. We stayed on a value package in this hotel and while we were pleased with what we got for the money we paid, I probably wouldn't go back to this hotel because it's just that little bit too far away from Kinsale town.
reviews.title: A fantastic weekend at the Carlton Hotel Kinsale

reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband for one night. When we arrived and went to our room there was a musty smell and we'd to leave the window open for the duration of our stay. The bathroom was nice but the lighting in the bathroom was too dim.
reviews.title: Not enough attention to the important details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had pre-booked afternoon tea. Service was poor with our pot of tea arriving at least 10minutes before any food was served to us. The cups and jug were filthy with tea stains on them. The bar area itself was dirty and non-inviting. The staff at breakfast the following morning should adopt a more personable style.
reviews.title: small beds !!

reviews.text: The pool was nice and the temperature of the water was nice.
reviews.title: Relaxing midweek break

reviews.text: We booked in for a one night stay, The reception area was bright and cheerful and manned by very helpful staff. The first room we we given had a "double" ?? bed hardly big enough for one not to mind two people. On asking at reception we were transferred to a room with a bigger bed. We were told that they had only one room with a king sized bed per floor. Anyone looking to stay there would be well advised to check the bed size in advance. and look for room 119. We booked dinner for 7.30. our order was taken but the starter did not arrive for an hour !
reviews.title: Great one night stay- excellent stay,excellent staff!!

reviews.text: Just home from a fantastic two night stay. Located outside kinsale in lovely quiet area with beautiful views hotel modern and beautifully decorated. Staff were excellent David in bar very friendly and helpful. Food is amazing great selection.
reviews.title: Carlton
Lovely hotel with beautiful views
reviews.text: The grounds of this hotel are nice, but it is the view from the back that is the special part. Our room was comfortable and the views were stunning. The hotel bar was lacking in atmosphere and the staff seemed a bit inexperienced but the hotel provides a minibus service to the lovely town of Kinsale, where there is plenty of nightlife to choose from. Breakfast the next morning was lovely.

I stayed here mid week with my husband and son. It was really relaxing. Everything was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The beds were comfy and the breakfast really good. The views were lovely too. Will be returning some day.
reviews.title: very relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for seeing Cork, very friendly and helpful staff with excellent food and a great selection for breakfast. Didnt use the spa but it looked lovely. all around a great stay, will defiantly go back again
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: My family and I stayed for 4 days for my fathers birthday, had a wonderful stay all together in a 3 bed apartment. The views are spectacular, the staff are friendly and the food is divine, and all for amazing value!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel, fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three lovely relaxing days in this wonderful location. The Hotel is classed as a four star and it should qualify for that high standard. However it falls slightly short of the fourth star because there does not seem to be an effective Management structure. Room was very comfortable and Breakfast was very good with a good choice. Spa and fitness centre very good. We had one evening meal there and the service left a lot to be desired. With a designated front of house person the service could be more than efficient. This same person could ensure that the dishes were served to customers satisfaction
reviews.title: Very good Hotel in Beautiful Location

description: Carlton Hotel Kinsale is set on 90 acres of mature wooded parkland with panoramic views overlooking Oysterhaven Bay, this luxury Kinsale hotel are committed to providing the highest standards and take pride in their tranquil surroundings.
